title: How to tune my upright piano to sound like a saloon piano - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t ruin a good upright by making it sound like a saloon (honky-tonk) piano. Go find one that’s cheap. There are likely lots of places (for instance, churches that are closing, and that have been around for a number of decades) that have partially decrepit, out-of-tune pianos hanging around in storage rooms, classrooms that are no longer used, etc. ,that they’d love to get rid of for next to nothing.

It’s a natural process that takes time. Here’s how you do it: Get the piano tuned properly, and then wait a few years. It will automatically take on that rich saloon piano sound, especially when you play saloon-style music. Then, be careful to avoid having the piano tuned, so you don’t ruin it.
